snippet: Mott Hall Bridges Academy, a public middle school in Brownsville, Brooklyn, the poorest neighborhood in New York City, is seen by many as a safe zone in a crime-plagued area, and a gateway out of generational poverty.
abstract: Mott Hall Bridges Academy, public middle school in Brownsville, Brooklyn, poorest neighborhood in New York City, is seen by many as safe zone in crime-plagued area, and gateway out of generational poverty; 72 of school's 75 graduates in 2014 enrolled in high schools outside of Brownsville (Series: The Poorest Neighborhood).
lead_paragraph: Mott Hall Bridges Academy, a public middle school in Brownsville, Brooklyn, the poorest neighborhood in New York City, is seen by many as a safe zone in a crime-plagued area, and a gateway out of generational poverty.

headline.main: A Brooklyn School’s Curriculum Includes Ambition
headline.print_headline: A Brownsville School’s Curriculum Includes Ambition
headline.content_kicker: The Poorest Neighborhood: A Refuge and a Gateway
headline.kicker: The Poorest Neighborhood: A Refuge and a Gateway
